p: Existing evidence suggests that VBD burdens will increase for people whom are already vulnerable to climate extremes, such as those in the African continent. This is notably pronounced in the dryland areas in the sub-Saharan and Sahelian region [ 47]. In this region, poor agro-pastoral communities may suffer socio-economically disproportionally more from the effects of changing climate [ 48, 49], and thus may become more vulnerable to VBD threats.
